statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ -4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 18 \\ -3 \\ 24 \\ 3 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -13 \\ 6 \\ 9 \\ 10 \\ 7 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ -4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 18 \\ -3 \\ 24 \\ 3 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -13 \\ 6 \\ 9 \\ 10 \\ 7 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
